data.title: Urology Care Of The Highest Standard
data.meta_description: Urology Care of the Highest Standard. Oregon Urology Institute offers specialized care from the nation’s leading urologists.
data.text:
Dr. Bodell is an accomplished osteopathic physician and surgeon who enjoys using her specialized expertise in female urology, incontinence, and pelvic reconstruction to improve her patients’ quality of life. She also has an excellent reputation for treating general urological problems such as stones, erectile dysfunction, and bladder cancer.

Dr. DiMarco is an honor society physician specializing in female pelvic medicine and reconstructive surgery. Her interests include successful treatment and care of female urology and urogynecologic issues. Even after a prestigious fellowship at the Mayo Graduate School of Medicine, Dr. DiMarco continues to be impressed with the caliber of expertise and leading edge standards here at Oregon Urology Institute.

Trained in an era when robotic surgery began reinventing major urological treatments, Dr. DiMarco quickly became a valuable and accomplished specialist in this field. He has since published a vast array of medical papers on the topic, as well as presented to dozens of medical societies, key conferences, and medical schools.

Dr. Ferguson graduated from medical school at the top-ranked Washington University in St. Louis and then stayed to train in urologic surgery and continue her research. During her residency, she was able to present her work over 20 times both nationally and internationally, publish a book chapter, and author over a dozen journal articles. Besides making significant contributions to urologic research, she was also able to hone her surgical skills and was well known for the excellent care she took of patients and her emphasis on quality of life. She now practices general urology with an interest in female urology, urologic incontinence, vasectomies, stone disease, and erectile dysfunction.

Dr. Hoff trained at the University of Missouri School of Medicine, Columbia after joining the Air Force. He then completed his urology residency at the University of Wisconsin, Madison. Dr. Hoff joined our Institute after heading the Urology Department at Nellis Air Force Base. He specialized in minimally invasive surgery, such as robotics, laparoscopy, endourology, and cryotherapy.

With a MD and MPH (Master of Public Health) from Louisiana State University, residency at the University of Miami, and a fellowship at the Australian Institute for Robotic Surgery, Dr. Kyle brings an impressive resumé to the Institute (not to mention fluency in Spanish). What may be the most important thing is his rich history of volunteer work, showing that, for him, it’s all about the quality of life for his patients.

Dr. McKimmy graduated from the College of Pharmacy at Oregon State University and practiced as a hospital pharmacist at Oregon Health Sciences University. He went on to complete his urology training at Albany Medical College in New York. He presently serves on the Oregon Board of Medical Examiners. His areas of practice concentration are incontinence, voiding dysfunction, pediatrics, prosthetic surgery and reconstructive urology. He also serves as a consulting urologist to the Child Development and Rehabilitation Center.

A native of Oregon, Dr. Mehlhaff attended Beloit College in Wisconsin followed by medical school at Oregon Health Sciences University. After completing general surgery and urology residencies at Albany Medical Center he joined the Department of Urology as an Assistant Professor. For the past 20 years he has practiced in Eugene, Oregon. At the Oregon Urology Institute as Medical Director of Research, he oversees numerous clinical trials in advanced prostate cancer and benign prostate conditions. At Oregon Urology Institute he has developed a comprehensive bone health and advanced prostate cancer clinic. Dr. Mehlhaff is also a managing partner of Oregon Urology Institute. He is a past Board member of LUGPA and the Oregon Urology Society.

Dr. Thomas Edward Stout is a highly accomplished urologist with a diverse educational background and impressive track record of professional achievements. He earned his M.D. with High Honors from Baylor College of Medicine, where he was awarded the Arnold Award for Excellence in Urology and was a member of the Alpha Omega Alpha honor society. After completing his urologic residency at the University of Minnesota, Dr. Stout pursued additional training as an Endourology and advanced robotics fellow at the University of Iowa. His research contributions include numerous peer-reviewed publications, book chapters, and presentations at national and international conferences. His clinical interests include robotic surgery for oncologic and benign conditions, complex stone disease, as well as general urology. Outside of work, Dr. Stout enjoys cycling, backpacking, and live music. His passion for excellence in urology and commitment to patient care make him a valued healthcare professional at OUI.

After graduating from OHSU and Pacific University, Dr. Walker trained in surgery and general urology at the University of Utah. His research in groundbreaking urological treatments and successful treatments in minimally invasive surgery and oncology earned him the position of chief of surgery at McKenzie-Willamette Medical Center from 2003-2006.

After winning three prestigious research fellowships in Iowa and Oregon, Dr. Woolsey went on to The University of Iowa College of Medicine. A prominent residency at the University of Virginia furthered his training in one of his areas of specialty: robotic surgery. He now practices general urology with an emphasis in robotic surgery, minimally invasive surgery, stone disease and prostate disease.

A native of Tennessee, Cody pursued a career in medicine following four years of service in the Marine Corps. He completed his Master of Physician Assistant Studies at Marquette University. He is passionate about evidence-based medicine. His approach to medicine places an emphasis on patient education, which allows patients to make informed decisions regarding their care. Outside of medicine he enjoys fishing, hiking, and Brazilian Jiu Jitsu.

Patrick Dahl, PA-C received his undergraduate degree in Health Science from Idaho

State University. He went on to receive his Master’s degree in Physician Assistant

Studies at Rocky Mountain College in Montana. He spent the first 10 years of his career

in Family Medicine in Eugene, Oregon before joining Oregon Urology Institute in 2024.

He is certified by the National Commission on Certification of Physician Assistants.

A native Oregonian, Cameron is pleased to be back in the state after finishing his physician assistant training in New Mexico. With his experience in surgical care and family medicine, he is excited to bring that background to urological care. Cameron believes patients should be well informed and educated about their medical care and focuses on that goal.

After serving in the Army for six years as a Medical Specialist with an Emergency Medicine background, Joe went on to school to pursue Physician Assistant Studies. He obtained his degree at MEDEX Northwest Division of Physician Assistant Studies, at the University of Washington, School of Medicine. He enjoys working closely with his patients, with the philosophy that the patient comes first and should be at the forefront of their healthcare decisions, with all options available. He is a native Oregonian.

Victoria is an Oregonian and grew up in a rural town near Salem before going to Portland for her master’s degree in physician assistant studies at Oregon Health and Science University. She then moved to Veneta and worked in family medicine for over 4 years. She has a special interest in urology after a rotation with a urology practice in Bend, Oregon. She values the approach of looking at the whole person and the importance of patient quality of life. She enjoys running, hiking, cooking, gardening, knitting and making soap in her free time.

Laurel joined OUI after 9 years in Family Practice, where she specialized in women's

health and gender-affirming care. She has found a love of Urogynecology working with

Dr. Connie DiMarco. She enjoys empowering people to take an active role in their

health and healthcare. Outside of the office, she enjoys adventures with her family,

finger painting, and good puns.

Laurel received her Bachelor of Arts in Psychology & Women’s Studies from Kalamazoo

College in Kalamazoo, Michigan. She received her Master of Physician Assistant Studies from Oregon Health & Science University.

Angela graduated from Duke University’s Physician Assistant Program. With her previous experience in neurosurgery, orthopedics, radiology, physical therapy and sports medicine, Angela has a broad spectrum of expertise that she has carried into urology. Angela uses a patient care philosophy of being a partner with each patient in their care to be certain that their quality of life goals are met.

Mark spent 10 years in the Navy as a Hospital Corpsman stationed mostly with the Marines providing healthcare and combat medicine. While on active duty he also received a masters degree in sports medicine and is a certified athletic trainer. Mark then went on to obtain his masters as a physician assistant at the University of South Alabama in Mobile. He moved to the Northwest and was providing Orthopedic and pain management in Coos Bay and then Eugene. He joined Oregon Urology in January of 2019. He provides general urology with an strong emphasis in advanced prostate cancer. He is focused on patient education and understanding of pathology and treatment options.
